item.title: `Rich's Restoring Levels Method
item.dc:creator: @WRX WRX`
item.description:
@WRX wrote:

Kay, i used his method, thing is. It doesn’t recognize the “IsDead” Method, although i used it before in my source.

I have Devolution source, and here is the method:

if (System.currentTimeMillis() - StatDelay > 50000 && !IsDead) {
			for (int i1 = 0; i1 < playerLevel.length; i1++) {
				if (playerLevel[i1] < getLevelForXP(playerXP[i1])) {
					playerLevel[i1] += 1;
					setSkillLevel(i1, playerLevel[i1], playerXP[i1]);
					NewHP = playerLevel[3];
				} else if (playerLevel[i1] > getLevelForXP(playerXP[i1])) {
					playerLevel[i1] -= 1;
					setSkillLevel(i1, playerLevel[i1], playerXP[i1]);
					NewHP = playerLevel[3];
				}
			}
			StatDelay = System.currentTimeMillis();
		}

Modification:
To fix this, for my devo version, i used the following code instead of the aforementioned one.
(This should have same effect)

if (System.currentTimeMillis() - StatDelay > 50000 && deathStage != 2) {
			for (int i1 = 0; i1 < playerLevel.length; i1++) {
				if (playerLevel[i1] < getLevelForXP(playerXP[i1])) {
					playerLevel[i1] += 1;
					setSkillLevel(i1, playerLevel[i1], playerXP[i1]);
					NewHP = playerLevel[3];
				} else if (playerLevel[i1] > getLevelForXP(playerXP[i1])) {
					playerLevel[i1] -= 1;
					setSkillLevel(i1, playerLevel[i1], playerXP[i1]);
					NewHP = playerLevel[3];
				}
			}
			StatDelay = System.currentTimeMillis();
		}

Read full topic
